text:
Panel (b) of Figure 10 illustrates long-run equilibrium for a representative firm after new
firms have entered the market. As indicated, the entry of new firms shifts the demand
curve faced by each individual firm down to the point where price equals average total
cost (P* = ATC“), such that economic profit is zero. At this point, there is no longer an
incentive for new firms to enter the market, and long-run equilibrium is established. The
firm in monopolistic competition continues to produce at the quantity where MR = MC
but no longer earns positive economic profits.
